algorithm.bdy:
The inside-outside algorithm is a way of re-estimating production probabilities in a probabilistic context-free grammar. It was introduced by James K. Baker in 1979 as a generalization of the forward-backward algorithm for parameter estimation on hidden Markov models to
stochastic context-free grammars . It is a variant of the
Expectation-maximization algorithm
, in which the basic assumption is that a "good" grammar is one that makes sentences in the training corpus likely to occur.
